Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 01:52AM RobinH wrote: My experience was this:  Radiologist looked at ultrasound and ordered an ultra sound guided aspiration.  He called my cyst "complex".  The lady who wound up giving me this information told me there was  debris in the cyst and I would be having the US guided aspiration and biopsy, if necessary.  Okay...MAJOR FREAK OUT and joined this board.  When I had the procedure, the radiologist couldn't understand why I was so nervous since it looked like "just a cyst" which was a little mis shapen probably because there were little cysts right next to it (hence the aspiration).  (something like that)   Point being...the lady who said you are getting that other procedure done on your node MIGHT not be correct.  Meaning...I did not require a biopsy although the lady who spoke to me made me think I might.  By no means am I trying to minimize a possibly serious situation...just saying she MIGHT have meant the node biopsy IF necessary. Just my 2 cents. Anyway...hopefully you will know soon...I know the waiting is the worst.

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2012 07:57AM RobinH wrote: Angel...recently I had a chest x ray because I had a cough.  The X ray showed a small nodule in my left lung.  They want to cat scan that.  The reason I'm not really worried is because 15 years ago when I had pneumonia, what I believe to be the same nodule was discovered and ruled out as a problem.  I think they didn't look at the records from way back then, although I have them...and I gave it to them.  They said the technology is so much better now that they want to cat scan me anyway.  When I had pneumonia 15 years ago, they found so many nodules here, there and everywhere...I was positive I was gonna die.  Everything turned out to be nothing.    Anyway...thanks for listening.  :)
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2012 10:44PM - edited Jan 16, 2012 10:44PM by RobinH I had a rough day too, ladies.  I made my appt for my US guided aspiration and I also have a cat scan (unrelated and I'm not too worried about it) appt set up.  So I thought about it all day.  I didn't do what I love to do...ride my horse...because I thought I wouldn't enjoy it.  So...I didn't have a good day.  But, I was just chatting with an on-line friend who told me she has had the same procedure I'm having...several times...and she's fine.  I know her experience won't necessarily be mine...but it made me feel a thousand times better.  Tomorrow I go to work.    And I find myself telling everyone I talk to (almost) what I'm going through.  I can't seem to keep my mouth shut.

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2012 08:30PM RobinH wrote: As it turned out...the radiologist was surprised I was  so nervous as he said he can see it's "just a cyst" and was certain the aspiration was gonna be enough.  I was like "Really?  Why didn't anyone say that to begin with????"   So immediately I felt better, and sure enough...he aspirated it and it disappeared!  No biopsy even necessary.  If the radiologist who checked the original sonogram had been the one to tell me they needed to aspirate it, he or she could have made the whole ordeal so much less nerve wracking...by telling me what today's radiologist said.  The person who initially told me sounded much more foreboding....thus scaring the crap out of me.   There is no moral to this story...I'm sure if this happens again, I'll be just as nervous.  It's hard not to be.   I wish all of you the very best and I thank you so much for all your support during this horrible time.  I will stick around this site and maybe be able to assuage some other peoples' fears.

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2012 12:47PM RobinH wrote: Oh okay.  Just didn't understand.  I have gotten reports before on other matters.  They are helpful and important.  Plus after several years, they tend to "forget" what went on before.  15 years ago, during a bout of pneumonia, they discovered a nodule in my left lung.  After checking it out they decided it was nothing... a "granuloma".  Fast forward to the beginning of this month:  I went for a chest x ray and they rediscovered it.  They didn't seem to know they saw it before.  So I gave them the records I had kept.  Nevertheless they sent me for a catscan which just proved it was still the same nothing.  But I was proud of myself for having those old records.   For me, and maybe I'm in denial...the words "just a fluid filled cyst" was enough for me.
